name: inf00

stmt.origin: eqtri(cinf(c0, emptycls, c1), emptycls, csup(c0, emptycls, ccnv(c1)))

body.origin:
|- wceq(cinf(c0, emptycls, c1), emptycls)
-| wceq(cinf(c0, emptycls, c1), csup(c0, emptycls, ccnv(c1)))
-| wceq(csup(c0, emptycls, ccnv(c1)), emptycls)

cumulated.origin:
|- wceq(cinf(c0, emptycls, c1), emptycls)
-| wceq(cinf(c0, emptycls, c1), csup(c0, emptycls, ccnv(c1)))
-| wceq(csup(c0, emptycls, ccnv(c1)), emptycls)

body.origin: |- wceq(cinf(c0, emptycls, c1), csup(c0, emptycls, ccnv(c1)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wceq(cinf(c0, emptycls, c1), emptycls)
-| wceq(csup(c0, emptycls, ccnv(c1)), emptycls)

comment: The infimum regarding an empty base set is always the empty set. (Contributed by AV, 4-Sep-2020.)
